text.tspan: BE shoulder_slope w E's x = C's x
FE shoulder_length w F's y = C's y
FG is perpendicular to FE with G's y = D's y
GH ½” line at 45 deg from FG and GD
OP bust_span parallel to CF passing through N
OQ bust_arc (Made of OP and QP)
PR QP +1/2" where R's y = I's y
RS side_seam_length with line passing through Q
Find W on line SV where SW is waist_arc - dart_placement

1/8” squared out from T (the diagram does not show this step because drawing 1/8” is very hard to see/draw). This is the ease added to bust. It may not seem like a lot but 1/8” ease on front and back will give ½” in the round
